Posts.Content: ramchaza wrote: My 35 year old niece has HER2, stage 4, (Inflamatory breast cancer) all over her body now. She's getting chemo, in clinical trials, will bave a double mastec., and a forced menopause.  She's not to the point where she's thinking about what this will do to her as a woman. I'm looking for books, maybe from a feminist point of view? about what this does to a woman's mind. There has to be something out there along these lines! How to help her deal with this as a woman. I think she probably, from the little she's said, that she feels guilty thinking about it from that point of view, she's just in the "do what I have to to stay alive" which is of course good, but those other thoughts about how it'll affect her as a woman will be there, too.  Hope it makes sense what I'm asking. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Books? ramchaza Cafelovr

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2011 01:51AM ramchaza wrote: All really good advice. She was just diagnosed about a month ago, don't think she's ready for a forum. I'm going to pass along this forum info to her anyway, hopefully she'll make use of it!
